Apr 13

7 Easy and Effective Ways to Engage with Your College Athletics’ Community

With college hoops in the rearview mirror, we can now switch gears and focus 100% on the plethora of spring sports that are already in full swing. And of course, we can start gearing up for the always exciting football season as it will be here before we know it!

But even when the ball stops bouncing or the stadium empties out, the college athletic community remains very active and engaged on the social media stage.

Here at Tagboard, we want to make sure your university is maximizing the amazing content being pushed out by fans, students, and athletes year round. So we compiled 7 easy and effective ways to showcase the omnipresent support your athletic department receives.

  1. Grow Your Snapchat Following: Snapchat is one of the most popular and fastest growing social media platform out there. Use a Snap-to-add code on screens and on your website to get fans following you on Snapchat, and instantly engage them with your stories. Fans love to see behind-the-scenes content, fun interactions with players and coaches, and whatever creative stories you drum up. We’ve seen this tactic play out successfully on live broadcasts with the likes of The Golf Channel, as well as in-stadium social displays for teams in leagues that include NCAA, NFL, NBA, MLB, MLS, EPL, and even in Japan’s National Baseball League.
“In the first month using Snapchat displays powered by Tagboard at Pelicans home games, we doubled our Snapchat followers from 10,000 to 20,000,” -Doug Tatum, EVP of Digital, New Orleans Saints-Pelicans

2. Bring Fans to the Forefront of the Gameday Experience: Kiss Cam’s are cute and all but not very interactive. On the other hand, if you let your fans know ahead of time that you’re going to highlight their social content on giant video boards, concourse TV screens, or even in the locker room on game day, you’re really going to capture everyone’s attention!

3. Power up those screens across your campus: Light up your Trophy Halls and public spaces with branded content to get the student body further engaged. Create interactive experiences in the most trafficked areas of your campus and athletic department; social content, historical images and videos can light up the space by playing in one continuous loop.

4. Add unique recruiting elements: Spruce up recruiting lounges, coaches’ offices, and locker rooms with social content from players, teams, and fans. You could even feature your recruit on the big screen! I mean, what better way to have a future player envision themselves at your university than by literally seeing themselves during a private tour?

5. Connect your social content and your team store: On social posts that feature coaches and athletes donning university apparel, drop a “shop now” button onto the post and embed it on your website. This works great on your athletic department’s website, a university bookstore website, or fan websites, giving folks the opportunity to purchase exclusive gear they see their heroes wearing. Cha-ching!

6. Create exclusive content to keep your Fans In-The-Know on Web and Mobile: Create a Social Media Hub on your website, so fans have one place to view all the cool content your department produces. By using our user social feeds, you’ll automatically pull in content for every sport across all platforms and then (voila!) showcase it on your website.

7. Battle It Out: What’s wrong with a little friendly competition between fans? Nothing! The Hashtag Battle allows fans to battle it out on social by answering fun questions like: who was the player of the game, what song should we play at halftime, or who should be the student-athlete of the week. If you can imagine it, your fans can hashtag battle it! Display it live at games, across campus, and on your web or mobile properties.

It’s all on the line! So give your athletes and their fans the experience they crave. They want to support their university, its brand, and all of the athletes that represent them. But more than anything, they want their voices to be heard. By utilizing these 7 social tools, everyone wins!

Need help? Let’s make it happen!

-Farren Benjamin, Sports Partnerships at Tagboard
